decks.notes: This deck focuses on aggressively disrupting the opponent's hand while deploying powerful threats like Nethergoyf and Thought-Knot Seer. It also utilizes efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Kozilek's Command to clear the way for its creatures. The inclusion of cards like Mishra's Bauble and Urza's Saga provides additional card advantage and utility. The deck aims to apply pressure early and consistently disrupt the opponent's game plan, eventually overwhelming them with a combination of efficient beaters and disruption.

This deck focuses on generating mana quickly and efficiently to ramp up to powerful threats like Primeval Titan. The key strategy involves using Amulet of Vigor and bounce lands like Simic Growth Chamber to generate multiple land drops per turn, allowing for explosive plays like casting Primeval Titan ahead of schedule or setting up lethal Scapeshifts to search for Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and deal massive damage. The deck also includes utility lands like Urza's Saga and Boseiju, Who Endures to support its combo-centric game plan.

The deck focuses on using ramp spells and mana acceleration to quickly cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End. It also includes control elements like Karn, the Great Creator and Kozilek's Return to disrupt the opponent's strategy. By combining fast mana, disruptive spells, and big threats, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and take control of the game. The deck's strategy revolves around efficiently ramping into Eldrazi creatures while disrupting the opponent's plans to secure victory in Modern 1 vs 1 matches.

The key strategy of this deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. By using cards like Thoughtseize and Solitude to control the board, and cards like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp to abuse enter-the-battlefield effects, you can keep your opponent on the back foot while building your own board presence. This "Death and Taxes" archetype aims to tax your opponent's resources and punish them for their plays, ultimately grinding them down for a victory.

The deck revolves around assembling the combo pieces needed to utilize Underworld Breach in order to loop through and recast powerful spells from the graveyard, generating significant advantage and potentially winning the game in a single turn. Emry, Lurker of the Loch, Mox Opal, Mishra's Bauble, and Grinding Station are key components to enable the combo, while cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Jace, Wielder of Mysteries provide additional value and potential alternate win conditions. The deck aims to quickly and efficiently set up the combo while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

This deck aims to control the game by using Eldrazi creatures and ramping up mana quickly. The key strategy involves using cards like Chalice of the Void and Karn, the Great Creator to disrupt opponent's plans while steadily building towards summoning powerful Eldrazi like Emrakul, the Promised End. The inclusion of artifacts like Mox Opal and Urza's Saga help to accelerate mana production, allowing for bigger plays earlier in the game. Overall, the deck relies on a combination of control elements and fast mana ramp to overwhelm opponents with massive Eldrazi threats.

This deck focuses on rapidly filling the graveyard with cards like Faithless Looting and Burning Inquiry to quickly bring out powerful creatures like Hollow One, Nethergoyf, and Detective's Phoenix. Utilizing cards like Lightning Bolt and Tarfire for removal and Orcish Bowmasters for additional damage, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays and efficient use of resources. The inclusion of Dauthi Voidwalker and Marauding Mako adds a level of disruption and evasiveness to the strategy, while Arena of Glory and Raucous Theater provide additional value and resource management.

The deck focuses on aggressively disrupting the opponent's game plan by utilizing cards that exile or remove key threats, while also deploying efficient creatures to apply pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Solitude, while also using creatures like Flickerwisp and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also has access to graveyard hate with Relic of Progenitus and card advantage with Ephemerate. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure to end the game quickly.

This combo deck aims to abuse the interaction between Underworld Breach and Emry, Lurker of the Loch to generate infinite mana and then win the game by milling the opponent with Grinding Station or looping spells with Jace, Wielder of Mysteries. The deck includes various artifact and land tutors, as well as card draw and disruption to ensure the combo pieces come together smoothly. The goal is to assemble the combo as quickly as possible while disrupting the opponent's game plan to secure the win.
